text:
sum1 = 0
sum2 = 0
sum3 = 0
str = "Hello again "
for i in str
    if i in string("e","a","u","i","o")
        global sum1 += 1
        # println(sum1)
    elseif i == " "
        global sum3 += 1
    else
        global sum2 += 1
        # println(sum2)
    end
end

elements.text:
sum1 = 0
sum2 = 0
sum3 = 0
str = "Hello again "
for i in str
    if i in string("e","a","u","i","o")
        global sum1 += 1
        # println(sum1)
    elseif i == " "
        global sum3 += 1
    else
        global sum2 += 1
        # println(sum2)
    end
end

text:
The problem is that you are iterating over characters, so in condition 2 you want to ask `elseif i == ' '` (if i is the space character)
but instead you are asking `elseif i == " "` (if i is a string composed only by the space character). They look like the same but they are slightly different.
So, something like this would work:
``` for i in str
           if i in "aeiou"
               global sum1 += 1
               # println(sum1)
           elseif i == ' '
               global sum3 += 1
           else
               global sum2 += 1
               # println(sum2)
           end
       end```

but instead you are asking

(if i is a string composed only by the space character). They look like the same but they are slightly different.
So, something like this would work:

for i in str
           if i in "aeiou"
               global sum1 += 1
               # println(sum1)
           elseif i == ' '
               global sum3 += 1
           else
               global sum2 += 1
               # println(sum2)
           end
       end

text: yes it works, so i have to use single ' not double ", thank you

text: and please do create a function that you can call and dispatch on. Then you have no need of those globals either.
